page.title: 16Customs in Wilton District
page.content: The custom of holding 3 sheep fairs at Wilton has long existed. These take place during the 2nd week of August, September and October by virtue of a charter granted by Henry VI in 1433. The Great September Sheep Fair is the largest held in S.W. England. An open market is held each Thursday in Wilton Market Square by right of an ancient charter. A fun fair coincides with the October Sheep Fair. The ceremony of Beating the Bounds takes place at Rogationtide. Wilton has the largest living Christmas Tree in the country and the Mayor performs the ceremony of switching on the Christmas lights. Quidhampton has its own version of the Mummers' Play which has been handed down by word of mouth. It is performed at Christmas in the village inn.
